actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the requirement that the 20 quarters of coverage which a fully insured individual generally needs in order to qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze must have been earned during a specified 40-quarter period.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Eliminates, under title II of the Social Security Act (Old-Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance), the requirement that the 20 quarters of coverage which a fully insured individual needs in order to qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze must have been earned during a specified 40-quarter period.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to eliminate the requirement that the 20 quarters of coverage which a fully insured individual generally needs in order to qualify for disability insurance benefits and the disability freeze must have been earned during a specified 40-quarter period.
